problem_text: 10.13. Does there exist a massive set of independent elements in a free group F2 on free generators a, b, that is, a set E of irreducible words on the alphabet a, b, a−1, b−1 such that 1) no element w ∈ E belongs to the normal closure of E \ {w}, and 2) the massiveness condition is satisfied: lim_{n→∞} (n^p/|E_n|) = 3, where E_n is the set of all words of length n in E? R. I. Grigorchuk
